title: Dallas Fed Survey Finds Jump in Energy Sector Activity
body: Activity in the U.S. oil and gas sector is surging, according to a report based on a Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas survey tracking conditions facing energy firms in the bank’s district. The report said the survey’s business activity index rose to 57.7 in the second quarter, beating the prior quarter’s record 56 reading. The survey also found input costs hit a record reading of 89, up from 77.1 in the first quarter.
